info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 1:28AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN JEFFERSON...SOUTHERN BEAVER...WASHINGTON...ALLEGHENY...SOUTHWESTERN WESTMORELAND... GREENE...NORTHWESTERN FAYETTE...BROOKE AND HANCOCK COUNTIES THROUGH 215 AM EDT... At 128 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Toronto to near Avella to 10 miles northeast of Hundred. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Pittsburgh, Mount Lebanon, Bethel Park, Ross Township, Monroeville, Moon Township, McMurray, Weirton, McKeesport, Washington, Franklin Park, and Uniontown. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 7 and 53. Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 65 and 68. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 6 and 71. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 46 and 78. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EDT for east central Ohio. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 600 AM EDT for western and southwestern Pennsylvania...and northern West Virginia.
